description.narrative: Two earthquakes in April and May caused massive damage in central Nepal, killing 8,856 people, destroying 543,000 homes and affecting 5.6 million people. The Nepal Red Cross Society (NRCS) launched an immediate relief effort, with other 8,000 volunteers taking part. 29 Red Cross and Red Crescent directly supported the response, as well as the IFRC and ICRC, and in total the RCRC Movement has provided emergency shelter to over 500,000 people, water and hygiene to over 500,000, and medical care to over 50,000.
